definitions.text: United States painter (born in England) of portraits and historical scenes (1783-1872)
place under suspicion or cast doubt upon
make dirty or spotty, as by exposure to air; also used metaphorically
examples: The silver was tarnished by the long exposure to the air
Her reputation was sullied after the affair with a married man

definitions.text: charge falsely or with malicious intent; attack the good name and reputation of someone
examples: The article in the paper sullied my reputation
